sen.j: 石山本願寺（いしやまほんがんじ）は、1496年(明応5)、蓮如のときに摂津国石山(大阪市中央区)に建てられ、後に浄土真宗の本山となっていた寺院である。
sen.e: Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, which became the head temple of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) later, was established in Ishiyama (Chuo ward, Osaka city), Settsu Province, in 1496, during the time of Rennyo.
sen.cmt: ＊「（大阪市中央区）」は現在の地名であるとおもわれますが、present-dayなどを付け足さず、記載どおりに地名だけを翻訳。
sen.e: Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, was established at Ishiyama in Settsu Province (Chuo Ward, Osaka City) in 1496, during the time of Rennyo, and later became the head temple of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism).

Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, was established at Ishiyama in Settsu Province (Chuo Ward, Osaka City) in 1496, during the time of Rennyo, and later became the head temple of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism).

sen.j: 当時の呼称は大坂御坊または大坂本願寺と言われる。
sen.e: It is said that the temple was called Osaka-gobo temple or Osaka Hongan-ji temple at that time.
It is said that the temple was originally called Osaka-gobo Temple or Osaka Hongan-ji Temple.
It is said that the temple was originally called Osaka-gobo Temple or Osaka Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 石山は上町台地の北端にある小高い丘で、真下で淀川と旧大和川が合流し、その付近に淀川水系や瀬戸内海の水運の拠点で、住吉や堺、紀州に向かう陸上交通の起点でもある渡辺津が形成されていた。
sen.e: Watanabeno-tsu port, which was the hub of the water traffic along the Yodo-gawa Water System and on the Seto Inland Sea, and was the start point of the land traffic to Sumiyoshi, Sakai, and Kisyu, was formed around the meeting point of the Yodo-gawa river and the former Yamato-gawa river right at the foot of the Ishiyama hill, a low hill located at the north end of Uemachi-daichi tableland.
sen.cmt: ＊「石山」は丘であるとの原文記載があり、地図上でも石山との名の山地を確認できませんでしたのでMt Ishiとはせず、Ishiyama hillと致しました。
sen.e: Ishiyama was a low hill located at the northern end of the Uemachi Plateau, rising above the point where the Yodo-gawa River and the former Yamato-gawa river met, and close to where the port of Watanabe-no-tsu, which was the hub of water traffic along the Yodo-gawa Water System and on the Seto Inland Sea, and the departure point for land traffic to Sumiyoshi, Sakai, and Kishu, was established.

Ishiyama was a low hill located at the northern end of the Uemachi Plateau, rising above the point where the Yodo-gawa River and the former Yamato-gawa river met, and close to where the port of Watanabe-no-tsu, which was the hub of water traffic along the Yodo-gawa Water System and on the Seto Inland Sea, and the departure point for land traffic to Sumiyoshi, Sakai, and Kishu, was established.

sen.j: 蓮如の隠居坊から次第に拡大して寺内町を形成して商工民などが住み自治が行われた。
sen.e: Jinai-cho (temple village), where merchants and artisans lived and governed themselves, was gradually formed and enlarged around the Inkyo-bo (home to live after retirement) of Rennyo.
sen.cmt: ＊隠居坊は定訳不明。蓮如が隠居生活をした家屋を指すものと推測し、推測した意味を、初出のみローマ字表記後に括弧つきで訳しました。
sen.e: Following the enlargement of Rennyo's retirement retreat, a jinai-cho (town within temple precincts) sprung up, where merchants and artisans lived and governed themselves.
Following the enlargement of Rennyo's retirement retreat, Ishiyama grew to a jinai-cho (town within temple precincts), where merchants and artisans lived and governed themselves.
sen.cmt: 原文は「石山が隠居坊から発展して寺内町を形成した」という趣旨と理解します。石山→渡辺津→寺内町→小坂→大阪という関係を明らかにするのが分かり易いと思います。

sen.j: この寺内町が、台地にそった坂にあることから「小坂」、後に「大坂」と呼ばれるようになった（大坂という地名の出現は1498年とされる）。
sen.e: The Jinai-cho was called 'Kosaka' ("saka" included in the name means "slope" in Japanese) because it was located on the slope of the tableland, and later, it came to be called 'Osaka' ("saka" included in the name means "slope" in Japanese) (It is said that the name of the place, Osaka, started to be used in 1498).
sen.cmt: ＊文意を考え、大坂、小坂の「坂」の意味を括弧つきで補って訳しております。＊「台地に沿った坂にある」は、台地側面の傾斜状の領域に町が形成されたと考えて訳しました。
sen.e: The jinai-cho was called 'Kosaka', which literally means 'small slope', because it was located on a slope up to the plateau, and later came to be called 'Osaka', meaning 'big slope' (it is said that the name "Osaka" started to be used in 1498).

The jinai-cho was called 'Kosaka', which literally means 'small slope', because it was located on a slope up to the plateau, and later came to be called 'Osaka', meaning 'big slope' (it is said that the name "Osaka" started to be used in 1498).

sen.j: 蓮如の隠居房であった事から、ここを崇敬する門徒も多く、本山であった山科本願寺をも圧倒する勢いを見せる。
sen.e: The Jinai-cho was venerated by many followers of the temple because the Inkyo-bo of Rennyo was located there, and its power almost overwhelmed the one of the head temple, Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple.
Many followers revered the site because of Rennyo's retreat, and its power began to overwhelm the head temple, Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple.
Many followers revered the site because of Rennyo's retreat, and its power began to overwhelm the head temple, Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: これを危惧した蓮如の後継者実如は永正元年（1504年）石山門徒の鎮圧に踏み切った（「大坂一乱」・また石山門徒には河内国出身者が多かった事から「享禄・天文の乱」とも）。
sen.e: Jitsunyo, who was a successor of Rennyo, felt uneasy about the situation and started to break down the followers of Ishiyama (The conflict is known as 'Osakaichiran war', or, it is occasionally called 'Kyoroku-Tembun war' because many of the followers of Ishiyama was from Kawachi Province)
sen.cmt: ＊「石山門徒」はfollowers in Ishiyamaかとも思いましたが、用語登録どおりfollowers of Ishiyamaで訳しました。＊「河内出身者が…乱とも」は乱の名前が享禄・天文の乱ではなく、河内国錯乱の間違いではと思われましたが、原文どおりで翻訳いたしました。＊大阪一乱(おおさかいちらん)は読みの区切りがどこになるかが解からず、Osakaichiran war（Osakaichi warではなく）といたしました。
sen.e: Jitsunyo, Rennyo's successor, felt uneasy about the situation and started to break up the followers of Ishiyama (the conflict is known as the 'Osakaichiran war' or, occasionally, as the 'Kyoroku-Tembun war' because many of the followers of Ishiyama were from Kawachi Province)

sen.j: だが天文 (元号)年間に山科本願寺を失った後には本山としての地位を確立する。
sen.e: However, after Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was lost during the Tenbun (the name of the era) era, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was firmly established as the head temple.
sen.cmt: ＊原文の「（元号）」は、文脈上省いても良いと思われましたが、原文記載どおり訳しました。
sen.e: However, after Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was lost during the Tenbun era (1532-1555), Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple became firmly established as the head temple.
However, after Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple was lost during the Tenbun era (1532-1555), Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple became firmly established as the head temple.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)末期には城郭に匹敵する堅固な石垣をめぐらして要塞化した。
sen.e: In the late Sengoku period (period of warring states) (in Japan), Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was fortified with stone walls which were as strong as castle walls.
sen.cmt: ＊原文の「（日本）」は、中国の戦国時代と区別するために記されたと思われ、文脈上省いても良いと思われましたが、原文記載どおり訳しました。
sen.e: In the late Sengoku (Warring States) period, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was fortified with stone walls which were as strong as castle walls.
In the late Sengoku (Warring States) period, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was fortified with stone walls which were as strong as castle walls.

sen.j: 織田信長との石山戦争では篭城戦を行ったが、10年に及ぶ戦闘の後、信長の攻勢に、1580年門主顕如は和睦。
sen.e: The temple was besieged during the Ishiyama War against Nobunaga ODA, and after a decade-long battle, the chief priest of the sect, Kennyo, who was under Nobunaga's attack, made a peace settlement with him in 1580.

The temple was besieged during the Ishiyama War by Nobunaga ODA and after a decade-long battle, the chief priest of the sect, Kennyo, under attack from Nobunaga, made a peace settlement with him in 1580.

The temple was besieged during the Ishiyama War by Nobunaga ODA and after a decade-long battle, the chief priest of the sect, Kennyo, under attack from Nobunaga, made a peace settlement with him in 1580.

sen.j: 長男の教如はこれに従わず下間頼龍らとともに籠城を続けたが、退去を命じられて、紀伊鷺森に移った。
sen.e: Although Kyonyo, the first son of Kennyo who did not agree with the peace settlement, continuously besieged himself in the temple together with his company including Rairyu SHIMOTSUMA, he was ordered to leave the place and moved to Kii Saginomori.

Kyonyo, Kennyo's eldest son, did not agree with the peace settlement and, with a few others, including Rairyu SHIMOTSUMA, continued to hold out in the temple, though eventually he was ordered to leave and moved to Kii Saginomori.

sen.j: その直後、石山本願寺は炎上した。
sen.e: Immediately after that, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was burnt down.
Immediately after that, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was burnt down.
Immediately after that, Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was burnt down.

sen.j: 石山本願寺の跡地に、豊臣秀吉が大坂城を築いた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Osaka-jo Castle on the site of former Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Osaka-jo Castle over the ruins of Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Osaka-jo Castle over the ruins of Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: また、同寺建立以前は、古墳であったとも言われ、生国魂神社の境内であったともいわれている。
sen.e: It is also said that there used to be a tumulus or the precincts of Ikukunitama-jinja Shrine at the site, before Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was built.
It is also said that there was a tumulus or the grounds of Ikukunitama-jinja Shrine at the site, before Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple was built.

sen.j: 同神社は太古からの神社であるため、石山が太古の磐座であったとの説もある。
sen.e: Some people say that the Ishiyama hill used to be an Iwakura (dwelling place of a god, usually in reference to a large rock) in ancient times, because Ikukunitama-jinja Shrine dates back to ancient times.
Some people say that because Ikukunitama-jinja Shrine dates back to ancient times, Ishiyama was an ancient 'iwakura' (dwelling place of a god).
